text:
JOURNALISM QUARTERLY SURVEY--2
6. Following is a list of articles appearing in the Winter, 1961, edition of
Journalism Quarterly. Please check, under the appropriate headings, the
extent to which you have read in each of the articles listed.
ARTICLE
Trends in Newspaper Ownership and Inter-Media Competition
Loss in Country Weekly Newspapers Heavy in 1950s
Effects of Cancer Scares: The Residue of News Impact
The Newspaper Reporter in a Suburban City
Congress and the Standing Committee of Correspondents
Mark Twain as Journalist and Liberary Man: A Contrast
Economic Intervention: Prelude to Press Control
Additional Data on Variables Related to a Press Freedom
Reporting a Gold Rush
Research in Brief
Book Reviews
Magazine Bibliographies
Foreign Bibliography
News Notes
AEJ 1960 Convention Minutes
AEJ Groups* 1960 Financial Report
7. How well does Journalism Quarterly keep its readers up to date on research in
the area of mass communications?
Very well_ Quite well_ Fairly well_ No opinion_ Not very well_
Not well at all_ It doesn't_
8. Do you think there is a need for another publication, on the plane of Journalism
Quarterly, in the area of mass communications?
Definitely_ Probably_ Possibly_ No Opinion_ Possibly not_
Probably not_ Definitely not_
9. Do you think Journalism Quarterly needs to publish more than four times a year?
Definitely_ Probably_ Possibly_ No Opinion_ Possibly not_
Probably not_ Definitely not_
10. a. Do you feel you can be as well informed on mass communications in general by
reading Journalism Quarterly as by reading any other journal devoted to mass
communications or a related area?
Definitely_ Probably_ Possibly_ About the Same_ Possibly not_
Probably not_ Definitely not_
b. What other scholarly journals, if any, are of most value to you? Please
list in order of relative value.
